docs.snippet: Courts have found his orders on lead paint, pesticides and other issues to be poorly crafted, and have struck them down.

headline.main: In His Haste to Roll Back Rules, Scott Pruitt, E.P.A. Chief, Risks His Agenda
headline.print_headline: In Rush to Kill Obama Rules,  Pruitt Puts His Agenda at Risk

byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and LISA FRIEDMAN

docs.snippet: In his inaugural speech, the new Fed chairman tried to focus on the strength of the economy even as a spiraling tariff battle with China spooked investors.

headline.main: More Jobs, Faster Growth and Now, the Threat of a Trade War
headline.print_headline: Trade Upheaval Casts a Shadow On the Recovery

byline.original: By BEN CASSELMAN and JIM TANKERSLEY

docs.snippet: Here is a selection of some of our favorite recent pieces, in case you missed them.

headline.main: Catching Up: Weekend Reads From Opinion
headline.print_headline: Catching Up: Weekend Reads From Opinion

docs.snippet: The trade clash between President Donald Trump and China's government is escalating, with Beijing pledging to "counterattack with great strength" if Trump follows through on threats to impose tariffs on an additional $100 billion in Chinese goods.

headline.main: White House Sends Mixed Signals on Trade Fight; Markets Dive
headline.print_headline: White House Sends Mixed Signals on Trade Fight; Markets Dive

docs.snippet: Anti-government activists accused the Syrian government of attacking a rebel-held suburb of Damascus with poison gas, estimating that dozens were killed.

headline.main: Poison Gas Attack Reported by Syrian Anti-Government Activists
headline.print_headline: Poison Gas Attack in Syria Is Reported by Activists

byline.original: By BEN HUBBARD and HWAIDA SAAD

docs.snippet: The Texas National Guard has begun deploying troops to help secure the state's southern border with Mexico as President Donald Trump has been unable to get the U.S. Congress or Mexico to fully fund his proposed wall along the border.

headline.main: Texas Sends 250 National Guard Troops to Mexico Border
headline.print_headline: Texas Sends 250 National Guard Troops to Mexico Border

docs.snippet: Turkey on Saturday criticized the United States over sending what it said were mixed messages on Syria, saying Washington was sowing confusion by equivocating about its future role in the country.

headline.main: Turkey Criticizes United States Over Mixed Messages on Syria
headline.print_headline: Turkey Criticizes United States Over Mixed Messages on Syria

docs.snippet: A survivor of the Parkland, Florida, school shooting joined the Rev. Al Sharpton on Saturday to announce a June rally in front of President Donald Trump's Manhattan apartment to protest gun violence eased by access to assault weapons.

headline.main: Sharpton, School Survivor, Announce Anti-Gun Violence Rally
headline.print_headline: Sharpton, School Survivor, Announce Anti-Gun Violence Rally

docs.snippet: North and South Korea on Saturday held talks over establishing a telephone hotline between their leaders and other communication issues ahead of a rare summit between the rivals later this month.

headline.main: Koreas Discuss Communication Issues Ahead of Summit
headline.print_headline: Koreas Discuss Communication Issues Ahead of Summit

docs.snippet: Fox News Channel host Sean Hannity is vowing to continue his attacks on ABC late-night comic Jimmy Kimmel until Kimmel apologizes for a segment in which he joked about first lady Melania Trump's accent.

headline.main: Hannity Vows to Bash Kimmel Until He Apologizes to 1st Lady
headline.print_headline: Hannity Vows to Bash Kimmel Until He Apologizes to 1st Lady
